alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 6:26AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Johnson and northeastern Hood Counties through 700 AM CST... At 625 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Granbury, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burleson, Cleburne, Granbury, Joshua, Pecan Plantation, Godley, Cross Timber, DeCordova, Cresson, Briaroaks, Stockton Bend, Waples, Mambrino, Egan, Lake Granbury and Acton. This includes Interstate 35W between mile markers 31 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
